questions.question_text:
Universal Containers needs to generate two styles of PDF output, one that includes prices in the line item table if the Quote is primary, and another that hides prices when the Quote Primary checkbox is False.

Where should the admin reference the Primary checkbox field to set up this requirement?

choices.D: The Hide Group Subtotals Field on the Quote Template
choices.A: The Hide Totals Field or the Quote Template
choices.B: The Conditional Print Field of a Template Section for only price Line Columns
choices.C: The Conditional Print Field for each price Line Column

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct here. Set on the template section belonging to only Price Lines to avoid setting redundant conditional print field values on each Line column.

B. The Conditional Print Field of a Template Section for only price Line Columns

Template Section > Conditional Print Field > Primary

choices.A: One or more Price Condition records have a lookup to a Summary Variable.
choices.C: The Price Rule uses a combination of AND and OR logic when evaluating three or more Price Conditions.
choices.D: The Price Rule uses a custom lookup object to store key-value pairs for Price Conditions.
choices.B: One or more Price Condition records use a formula that references a non-CPQ object field.

questions.question_text: In which scenario must an Admin choose the Custom value for the Condition Met field of a Price Rule?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct.

https://milomassimo.com/Salesforce-CPQ-Product-Rules-vs-Price-Rules.html#:~:text=Custom%20Value%C2%A0for%20the%20Condition%20Met%20field%20on%20a%20Rule%20which%20uses%20a%20combination%20of%20AND%20and%20OR%20logic%20for%20the%20evaluation%20of%20three%20or%20more%20conditions

choices.B: Create a single Template Section, and use the Group Field functionality to ensure appropriate grouping by Product Family.
choices.C: Create a single Template Section, and use the LineSortField special field to ensure appropriate grouping by Product Family.
choices.D: Create a Template Section for each Product Family, and set up the appropriate filtering within each section using the Filter field.
choices.A: Create a Template Section for each Product Family, and set up the appropriate filtering within each section using the Conditional Print field.

discussion.content:
B. Create a single Template Section, and use the Group Field functionality to ensure appropriate grouping by Product Family.

Template Section > Group Field (specify field used in grouping lines rendered by this section. Only applicable to Line Items section.) > Product Family

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers (UC) has categorized its Products into three Product Families. When rendering a document, UC wants to separate the Products into different Line Item tables by Product Family.

How should the admin meet the requirement in the most efficient manner?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

C - constrained
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.cpq_constraint_guidelines.htm&type=5

Constrained Option
Lookup to the option that Salesforce CPQ enables or disables.

Constraining Option
Lookup to the option that determines whether Salesforce CPQ enables or disables the Constrained Option.
